description: In Palestine, as of April 02, outside movement for essential purposes is only allowed from 10.00 am to 5.00 pm.
In Palestine, as of April 20, outside movement for essential purposes is only allowed from 10.00 am to 7.30 pm. UPDATE: As of April 20, the curfew times will be relaxed.
On March 6, 2020, the Palestinian Authority declared a state of emergency over the Coronavirus in Palestine.
In Palestine, March 06, "The Palestinian Authority has declared a state of emergency in the occupied West Bank over the coronavirus epidemic after seven people tested positive."
In Palestine, "on 3 April 2020, the President Abbas issued a decree introducing the State of Emergency in the occupied Palestinian Territories."

Palestine, on May 5 2020, issued a new decree for a state of emergency, effectively extending the previous state of emergency until June 5. UPDATE: The original state of emergency (ending on May 5) got extended to June 5.
In Palestine, on March 14, "The Gaza Strip government affiliated with Hamas announced (...) the closure of its crossings with Egypt and Israel in both directions."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Palestine Governor of the West Bank district of Nablus stated on June 19th that "preventive medicine crews will embark on mapping of potential cases of COVID-19 that may have contracted the disease after coming into contact with patients in the district."
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: In the Gaza Strip in Palestine, on March 02, a "quarantine center [was] set up by the Ministry of Health at the Rafah Crossing to host arrivals from China and countries that have spread "Corona"."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Palestine as of March 07, "a field hospital is being equipped near the Rafah crossing in the south of the Gaza Strip, with a capacity of 30 beds, as a first stage, and an intensive care department, and trained medical equipment and competencies."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Ramallah, Palestine, as of March 11, "a separate special section in the Governorate Health Directorate to diagnose cases of the emerging coronavirus" was opened.
type_sub_cat: Public Testing Facilities (e.g. drive-in testing for COVID-19)

description: In Ramallah, Palestine, on March 11, 2020 it was announced that a new new Department opens at a major hospital in order to examine and diagnose cases of COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Palestine, "the Hamas-run Ministry of Health began on March 15 turning two schools in the southern city of Rafah into quarantine centers where those entering Gaza are placed as a precautionary measure against spreading the coronavirus (...) Speaking to Al-Monitor, Ashraf al-Qidra, a spokesman for the Health Ministry, said there are 15 schools serving as quarantine centers in the Gaza Strip, and the ministry is equipping more schools for those arriving into Gaza."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As of March 30, in the Gaza Strip, Palestine, "[w]ork at outpatient clinics, non-emergency surgeries, and visits to inpatients at public hospitals have all been suspended. (...) The MoH has limited public primary healthcare service delivery in the Gaza Strip, to 14 centers distributed across the five governorates, which will be providing essential services only. "
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As of April 12, in the Westbank in Palestine, "the local authorities established 16 quarantine centres to receive incoming travelers, including workers from Israel, arriving to the West Bank. Additional community-based quarantine centres are in the process of being established in Palestinian refugee camps across the West Bank."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As of April 14, in Gaza, Palestine, a new laboratory for testing will be established, with finished assembly and equipment being expected on April 16. The laboratory is expected to conduct as many as 3.000 tests a day.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As of April 19, in Palestine: "In the West Bank, the MoH opened two testing sites: one in Jenin and one in Hebron. This is in addition to the existing testing sites in Ramallah (Central Public Health Laboratory), Bethlehem (Caritas Hospital) and Nablus (Al-Najaf University)."
type_sub_cat: Public Testing Facilities (e.g. drive-in testing for COVID-19)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: As of April 23, in the Westbank in Palestine, "the local authorities established 19 quarantine centres to receive incoming travelers, including workers from Israel, arriving to the West Bank. Additional community-based quarantine centres are in the process of being established in Palestinian refugee camps across the area." UPDATE: The number of quarantine centers established by local authorities have increased from 16 to 19.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: As of April 02, in the Westbank, Palestine, the Ministry of Health plans to check all the workers coming home from Israel during the week of the Jewish Passover holiday, estimating their number at around 60.000.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Palestine, as of May 03, "Local health authorities have announced some preventive occupational health and safety measures to be applied by workers and the general public", including mandatory access to hand sanitizers at facility entrances and regularly disinfecting frequently-touched services.

In Palestine, as of May 03, "Local health authorities have announced some preventive occupational health and safety measures to be applied by workers and the general public", including mandatory access to hand sanitizers at facility entrances and regularly disinfecting frequently-touched services.

In Palestine, "on the evening of March 22, the West Bank instituted a 14-day lockdown, banning the movement of citizens between Palestinian governorates and preventing citizens from leaving their homes unless necessary."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Palestine, "on the evening of March 22, the West Bank instituted a 14-day lockdown, banning the movement of citizens between Palestinian governorates and preventing citizens from leaving their homes unless necessary."

description: On March 15, 2020, a closure until further notice of mosques and churches in all the governorates of Palestine was ordered.

description: In Palestine, as of March 23, "Palestinian President Mahmud Abbas issued an amnesty order Sunday for some civil detainees as part of efforts to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus."
type_text: An Amnesty was issued by the president for all prisoners that have completed at least half their sentence.

description: In Palestine, on March 24, "Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh announced (...) that the organisation will allocate $500,000 to support Palestinian refugees living in camps in Lebanon during the coronavirus pandemic."
type_text: Humanitarian aid from Hamas to Palestinian Refugees in Lebanon.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 26, the Palestinian Authorities launch a National COVID-19 Response Plan.

description: As of April 20, all mosques and churches in all governorates will remain closed for Ramadan. UPDATE: As of April 20, mosques and churches will remain closed even with the advent of Ramadan.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Palestine, on March 09, The Palestinian Ministry of the Interior in Ramallah announced (...) beginning of combating the rumors spread about the emerging Coronavirus (Covid 19)."

In Palestine, the government established an official website on cases of infections, including medical progress, gender, location and age. The aim is keeping the public updated and preventing misinformation.

In Palestine, "The COVID-19 Risk Communications and Community Engagement Campaign, led by WHO and UNICEF,is in its fourth week (8-15 April) and has [d]eveloped specific messaging for Palestinian workers returning to the West Bank and Gaza from Israel (in partnership with ILO, Ministry of Labor and PNGO) to address stigma, protection measures and quarantine. The Campaign is distributing 157,000 brochures with MoH and UNRWA and has disseminated messages across 15 new billboards in Gaza."
In Gaza, Palestine, as of March 07, a quarantine of 14 days is imposed on everyone coming through the border crossings from the countries affected by the coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Palestine, as of March 22, all Palestinian citizens coming from abroad shall be placed under mandatory quarantine for 14 days in official quarantine centers.

description: In Gaza, Palestine, as of March 30, a quarantine of 21 days is imposed on everyone that has arrived through the border crossings since March 15. type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: In Palestine, as of March 07, "The city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank has been placed in lockdown after the first Palestinian cases of the new coronavirus were discovered there (...) Public parks and tourist sites would close while large sporting events, conferences and other major gatherings were cancelled"
In Ramallah, Palestine, as of March 10, all indoor and outdoor public gatherings are suspended.
In Gaza, Palestine, on March 14, it was announced by the Hamas-affiliated government that all institutions will be prevented from establishing any gatherings of more than 100 people.
In Palestine, as of April 20, all places for mass gatherings remain closed for Ramadan. UPDATE: As of April 20, all places for mass gatherings remain closed during Ramadan.
As of March 30, in the Gaza Strip, Palestine, "visits to inpatients at public hospitals have all been suspended."
